item.title: **HERstory: Amelia Bloomer**
item.description: Biographical Information Full Name: Amelia Jenks Bloomer Born: May 27th, 1818 Died: December 30th, 1894 Occupation: Women’sÂ Rights and Temperance Activist, Newspaper Owner Most Famous For: Popularized pants for women and was first woman to own a newspaper for women. Her Story Amelia Bloomer first became involved with women’s rights when she attended the Seneca Falls Convention in 1848, and soon after started to edit for the first newspaper for women.
